class BtSvrServiceRecord

Detailed Description

The result of a service verify request executed by the Bluetooth Stack is an object of the class BtServiceVerifyResult. This class is a collection of zero or more service records. The interface to these service records is built by the class BtSvrServiceRecord. A service record can be seen as a collection of zero or more service attributes.
One particular service attribute is represented by a BtServiceAttribute object that contains the description of that service attribute. In this context the expression "description" stands for the size of the service attribute and a pointer into the memory block of the corresponding BtServiceVerifyResult, where this serivce attribute starts.
There is no direct access to the memory block and its size. Instead of this there are functions defined to get access to the single properties like the unique identifier of this service attribute or the data element representing the value of this service attribute. These functions do not copy any data. They only store a descirption of the value in the passed in BtSvrDataElement. So the application programmer has to provide the memory for the storage of the data element.

Member Function Documentation

UINT16 BtSvrServiceAttribute::GetAttributeId (   )  const
 

Retrieve the identifier of this service attribute.

GetAttributeId returns the identifier of this service attribute. Each service attribute within a service record has an unique identifier.

Returns:
An UINT16 containing the unique identifier of thisBtSvrServiceAttribute. If this service attribute is not valid the constant UINT_MAX (0xFFFF) is returned

BOOLEAN BtSvrServiceAttribute::GetAttributeValue (  BtSvrDataElement &  svr_data_element  )  const
 

Retrieve the value of this service attribute.

GetAttributeValue returns the data element of this service attribute representing its value.

Parameters:
svr_data_element A reference to a BtSvrDataElement where to store the information of the retrieved attribute value.
Returns:
TRUE: The description of the value of this service attribute is stored in svr_data_element.
FALSE: An error occured. Do not use the content of svr_data_element because it is not valid.

BOOLEAN BtSvrServiceAttribute::IsValid (   )  const
 

Get validity of this service attribute.

IsValid returns the validity state of this service attribute.

Returns:
TRUE: This service attribute is valid. All other member functions return a result that can be used further.
FALSE: This service attribute is invalid. Do not call any further member functions because they allways will return an error.
